intro: Lophosciadium setifolium, commonly known as the hairy leaf scabweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in open grasslands and along roadsides. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
